title: I just withdrew 18k from my 401k. I paid the taxes on it and the penalties. Does it now count as income for the
question: Means Test? I can pass if the 18k is not considered income, but I fail if it does. I am filing in Santa Ana, CA. Thank you!
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy means test,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers: The 18k is clearly income from an IRS perspective, but it is a non-recurring receipt of money received (earned) in a previous year. I think you would have a good argument that it should not be counted, but I would suggest avoiding any risk of fraud by disclosing it along with an explanation of why it is not being included.

I am not 100% certain on this issue and you must confirm with your bankruptcy lawyer, but I believe that 401k distributions are not considered income for CMI purposes. The income was earned at the time the money went into the 401k, not when it comes out of the 401k.
Strictly from tax view point, it is considered 2017 taxable income and you will receive a 1099R by the end of January 2018. Good luck.
